trans-unit.source: A class that represents the category of a syndication feed.
A category allows you to assign one or more keywords that can be used to search for information.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance to initialize the new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> class with the given name.
The name of the category.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> class with the specified name, scheme, and label.
The name of the category.
A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that represents the categorization scheme to which this category belongs.
A human-readable attribute that describes the category.
Gets the attribute extensions for this category.
The syndication object model allows you to add custom attributes to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> instance.
Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications.
They are serialized as an attribute of the `<category>` element.
The attribute extensions for this category.
Creates a copy of a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance.
A new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory"></xref> instance.
Gets the element extensions for this category.
Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specification.
You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace.
A collection of element extensions.
Gets and sets the label of the category.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Label%2A> is written to the `label` attribute of the <`category`> element.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Label%2A> is not serialized to RSS 2.0.
The label of the category.
Gets and sets the name of the category.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Name%2A> is written to the `term` attribute of the <`category`> element.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Label%2A> is not serialized to RSS 2.0.
The name of the category.
Gets and sets the scheme of the category.
When serialized to Atom 1.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Scheme%2A> property is written to the `scheme` attribute of the <`category`> element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory.Scheme%2A> property is written to the `domain` attribute of the <`category`> element.
The scheme of the category.
Attempts to parse an attribute extension.
Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications.
They are serialized as an attribute of the `<category>` element.
This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom attribute extension.
To do this, derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> and override this method.
This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.
The name of the element.
The namespace of the element.
The attribute to parse.
The syndication version to use when parsing.
A value that specifies whether the attribute extension was parsed successfully.
Invalid XML encountered during read.
Attempts to parse an element extension.
Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications.
You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace.
This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom element extension.
To do this, derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> and override this method.
This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to read from.
The syndication version to use while parsing.
A value that specifies whether the element extension has been parsed successfully.
Invalid XML encountered during read.
Writes the attribute extensions to the specified writer.
Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications.
They are serialized as an attribute of the `<category>` element.
This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom attribute extensions.
To do this, derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> and override this method.
This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to write to.
The syndication version to use while writing.
Writes the element extensions to the specified writer.
Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specification.
You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace.
This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom element extensions.
To do this, derive a class from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> and override this method.
This method is called for all unrecognized element extensions.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to write to.
The syndication version to use while writing.
